title: iOS Provisioning Quiz
description: Test your understanding of iOS provisioning profiles, certificates, and code signing for KMP apps.

questions.text: What is the relationship between a signing certificate and a provisioning profile?
options: They are the same thing with different names
A provisioning profile links a signing certificate to an App ID and list of allowed devices
A signing certificate is only needed for Android; iOS uses provisioning profiles
A provisioning profile replaces the need for a signing certificate
questions.explanation: A provisioning profile bundles three things together: the signing certificate (who built it), the App ID (which app), and optionally a list of device UDIDs (where it can run). All three must match for iOS to allow the app to launch.

questions.text: What is the difference between a Development and Distribution provisioning profile?
options: Development profiles are free; Distribution profiles cost money
Development profiles allow debugging on specific devices; Distribution profiles allow App Store or TestFlight distribution
Development profiles are for Swift; Distribution profiles are for Kotlin
questions.explanation: Development profiles are tied to specific device UDIDs and enable debugging features. Distribution profiles (App Store or Ad Hoc) are used for releasing to TestFlight/App Store and do not include device restrictions (App Store) or include a broader device list (Ad Hoc).

questions.text: In a KMP project, which Gradle configuration typically specifies the iOS signing team ID?
options: The iosApp Xcode project settings or a Kotlin/Native framework export configuration
questions.explanation: iOS signing is managed in the Xcode project settings (Signing & Capabilities tab) for the iosApp target. The KMP shared module produces a framework, but signing happens at the Xcode project level where the team ID, provisioning profile, and bundle identifier are configured.
